description:
About Panorama

Panorama is a fast-growing national technology company focused on radically improving education. More than 2,000 school systems serving 15 million students across all 50 states have adopted our platform to understand students’ academic and social-emotional strengths and to identify those in need of additional support. School systems turn to our suite of tools to ensure that every child gets the support they need, including school climate and social-emotional learning surveys, tiered intervention planning, and professional development.

Panoramians can choose to work fully remote anywhere within the Continental United States, in-person from our Boston office, or a hybrid option.

About The Role

The Vice President, Government Affairs and State Partnerships will implement a multistate strategy to achieve Panorama Education’s growth objectives. This role will develop and advance Panorama’s state strategy agenda by helping design, implement, and coordinate the company’s strategic direction as it relates to outreach, messaging, and engagement with (1) elected officials, government officials and their staff and (2) State Departments of Education and State Boards of Education (state education agencies or “SEAs”). This role will also support Panorama’s Revenue Team with outreach, messaging and engagement with Top 100 school district Boards.

The successful candidate will deeply understand legislative, regulatory, and political processes including knowledge of how to influence state procurement processes to advance Panorama’s revenue goals and government affairs influence. The successful candidate will also build and maintain thriving cross-functional relationships across Panorama, especially with Panorama’s Revenue Team, to ensure strong collaboration, communication and execution of the Key Responsibilities below.

Key Responsibilities - State And District Enterprise Partnerships
• Collaborate with Panorama’s Revenue Team to develop and implement strategies to establish and maintain Panorama as a trusted partner with SEAs
• Support Panorama Revenue Team’s outreach, messaging and engagement with top 100 district decision-makers
• Advocate for Panorama’s products and services on the state level to sell and expand Panorama’s products and services in collaboration and alignment with Panorama’s Revenue Team
• Examples of such state level advocacy include: (A) opening new SEA sales opportunities and helping close these opportunities in partnerships with the Revenue Team; (B) providing material support to close SEA deals, including RFP support; (C) influencing at-risk SEA contracts to ensure contracts are not canceled or terminated; and (D) positioning state funding legislation for Panorama’s products and services
• For clarity, this role does not include responsibility for post-sale support for SEAs
• Build and support relationships with key stakeholders in the education sector including SEAs, district leaders, educational organizations, associations, and companies to expand Panorama’s network for state and enterprise sales and partnerships
• Use strong understanding of K12 education and the edtech ecosystem to contribute to go-to-market strategies, state and enterprise proposal responses, positioning, messaging in support of expanding revenue growth
• Develop relationships with potential grant funding partners and analyze opportunities released by states, foundations, and federal agencies

Key Responsibilities - Government Affairs
• Advocate for Panorama’s education and technology priorities on the federal and state levels
• Provide leadership for Panorama’s government affairs team
• Manage outside consulting, lobbying, public relations and association resources to achieve Panorama’s legislative, regulatory, and reputational goals
• Establish and maintain strong relationships with key partners in governmental and non-governmental agencies, organizations, associations, and companies to expand Panorama’s government affairs capacity
• Represent Panorama in meetings with state and federal officials and partners as needed
• Collaborate with Panorama executive leadership to execute effective government affairs strategies

Candidate Qualifications
• 15+ years of relevant government affairs and state education experience, with proven relationship and coalition building skills
• 5+ years people leadership experience - building, managing and mentoring a team
• Experience as a senior government affairs officer with a nationwide company or commercially oriented non-profit organization, preferred in education and technology
• Demonstrated experience in building and growing a state and enterprise program team
• Political relationship expertise, which may include federal or state legislators and education government agencies
• Demonstrated understanding of substantive policy issues in the education, technology, or privacy sectors
• A track record of ownership in managing objectives and engaging with stakeholders, both internal and external
• Experience in responding to state-level RFPs and grants

Base Salary: $189,000 - $252,000

The “Base Salary” range represents the low and high end of the anticipated salary range for this position across all US locations. The determination of this anticipated Base Salary range involves the consideration of many factors in making compensation decisions including but not limited to: unique skill sets, experience, training, performance, licensure and certifications, as well as other business and organizational needs. Our anticipated Base Salary determination is just one component of Panorama’s competitive total rewards strategy that also includes annual bonus or commission awards, equity awards, as well as other region-specific health and welfare benefits.

Panorama Education is dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive company because we serve students, educators and families from tremendously diverse backgrounds and identities across the country; we’ve seen how our product and impact are strengthened the more we reflect that diversity. In addition, we have found (and we believe the research) that diverse teams are higher-performing, and we embrace the varied perspectives that our team members share with each other. As such, we are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Panorama also has a policy on maintaining a drug-free workplace.
